isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1992 - 1993 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - WITH KYSOR ENGINE SHUTDOWN

svcproc.title: WITH KYSOR ENGINE SHUTDOWN
svcproc.para: When starting a Kysor equipped vehicle, ignition power to the PCU is controlled by the Kysor Control Module for the first 30 seconds. Power is supplied on circuit 19C to the PCU and the Fuel Shutoff Solenoid.

After the 30-second start interval, power to the PCU and fuel shutoff solenoid is controlled by the Alarmstat and the Pressurestat. Circuit 19J/19D from the alarmstat supplies power from the F4 fuse once sufficient oil pressure is available to close the NO contact in the pressurestat.
If oil pressure drops below 5 PSI or the coolant temperature rises above 225°F, the power to the PCU is turned off as the Kysor Shutdown System shuts down the engine to prevent damage.
